subject: Engineering Drawing

overview.description: Comprehensive engineering drawing curriculum providing essential technical communication skills through conventional drafting and computer-aided design for engineering and manufacturing careers

learning_objectives: Master technical drawing conventions and standards
Develop proficiency in both hand drafting and CAD software
Understand geometric dimensioning and tolerancing principles
Create detailed engineering drawings for manufacturing
Apply visualization and spatial reasoning skills to technical problems

units.title: Fundamental Drawing Techniques and Conventions
learning_outcomes: Master basic drafting tools and techniques
Understand international drawing standards and conventions
Create accurate orthographic and isometric projections
Apply line types, dimensioning, and annotation standards

lessons.title: Orthographic Projection and Multiview Drawing
objectives: Create accurate orthographic projections from 3D objects
Apply proper line weights and drawing conventions
Dimension drawings according to international standards

activities.description: Create orthographic projections of various mechanical objects
Apply proper dimensioning techniques and tolerancing
Apply international drawing standards and conventions
Peer review and quality assessment of drawings

resources: Drawing boards and technical drawing instruments
cross_curricular_connections: Art and Design: Visual communication and presentation

units.title: Computer-Aided Design (CAD) Fundamentals
learning_outcomes: Master 2D CAD software for technical drawing
Generate detailed drawings with automatic dimensioning
Understand CAD file management and collaboration

lessons.title: Parametric CAD Modeling and Drawing Generation
objectives: Create parametric 2D sketches with geometric constraints
Generate detailed technical drawings from CAD models
Apply automatic dimensioning and annotation tools

activities.description: Create constrained parametric sketches of mechanical components
Generate multiview drawings from parametric models
Apply automatic dimensioning and create detailed annotations
Practice drawing revision control and version management

cross_curricular_connections: Computer Technology: Software proficiency and digital skills
Mathematics: Coordinate systems and geometric relationships

units.title: Advanced Technical Drawing and Design
learning_outcomes: Create complex assembly drawings and exploded views
Understand manufacturing processes and their drawing requirements

lessons.title: Assembly Drawing and GD&T Application
objectives: Create detailed assembly drawings with bill of materials
Apply geometric dimensioning and tolerancing principles
Understand fit classifications and tolerance analysis

activities.description: Create complex mechanical assembly with multiple components
Apply geometric dimensioning and tolerancing to critical features
Analyze tolerance stack-up and fit conditions
Review drawings for manufacturability and cost optimization

resources: Advanced CAD software with GD&T capabilities
cross_curricular_connections: Mechanical Technology: Manufacturing processes and assembly
Quality Control: Measurement and inspection techniques

units.title: Specialized Drawing Applications and Project Work
learning_outcomes: Apply drawing skills to specialized engineering fields
Complete comprehensive design and drawing projects

lessons.title: Complete Technical Documentation Project
objectives: Develop complete technical documentation package for engineering project
Coordinate multiple drawing types and documentation standards
Present technical information for manufacturing and assembly

activities.description: Plan comprehensive technical documentation for chosen engineering project
Create complete set of technical drawings including details and assemblies
Compile technical documentation package with specifications
Present documentation package for technical review

cross_curricular_connections: Project Management: Planning and coordination skills

hand_drafting_projects: Mechanical component detail drawings using traditional instruments
Architectural floor plans and elevation drawings
Electrical schematic diagrams and circuit layouts
cad_projects: Complete product design from concept to manufacturing drawings
Reverse engineering and documentation of existing products
Parametric family of parts with configuration management
3D visualization and animation for technical communication
industry_applications: Technical documentation for school facility improvements
Design competition entries with complete documentation

2d_cad_software: AutoCAD for general purpose technical drawing
3d_cad_software: SolidWorks for mechanical design and manufacturing
Fusion 360 for integrated design and manufacturing
specialized_software: Revit for architectural and building information modeling
CATIA for aerospace and automotive applications

formative_assessments: Weekly drawing exercises and technique practice
Peer review and collaborative critique sessions

cad_certifications: Professional certifications in specialized CAD software
